data.title: Jordan Miller - Men's Basketball
data.meta_description:
Jordan Miller (13) Guard  - CAREER STATISTICS

Miller Notes: Has started all 85 games in his career ... begins the 2012-13 season ranked fourth in school history

Related

Stats

Biography

CAREER STATISTICS

Miller Notes: Has started all 85 games in his career ... begins the 2012-13 season ranked fourth in school history in 3-point field goals made (181), fifth in free throw pct. (82.8) and 12th in scoring (1,106) ... became the 17th player in program history to score 1,000 career points on Feb. 17, 2012 ... has led team in free throw pct. for three straight seasons ... signed with SMSU on May 6, 2008 ... redshirted during 2008-09 season.

2011-12: Started all 30 games ... named first team All-NSIC ... named to the NSIC All-Tournament team ... led team in scoring with 14.2 points per game ... connected on team-high 58 3-pointers ... ranked second on the team in both assists (84) and rebounding (4.2) ... scored 20 more points three times ... poured in season-high 24 points vs. Minnesota Duluth (2/18) ... recorded double-double vs. Milwaukee (11/12) ... made four 3-pointers in three different games ... led team in scoring 13 times ... led team in rebounding six times ... led team in assists 14 times ... played season-high 36 minutes vs. Milwaukee (11/12) ... season-high 11 rebounds vs. Milwaukee (11/12) ... finished fourth in the NSIC in free throw pct. and eighth in 3-pointers made ... ranked 105th in the country in free throw pct.

2010-11: Started all 26 games ... finished second on the team in scoring with 13.8 points per game ... averaged 4.4 rebounds per game ... led team with 52 3-pointers ... scored season-high 27 points vs. Concordia (2/11) ... grabbed season-high 10 rebounds vs. NW Missouri State (11/27) ... finished the season with 22 double-digit figure scoring games ... scored over 20 points in five games ... shot team-high 88.5 percent from the free-throw line, ranking fifth in school history ... dished out season-high eight assists vs. St. Cloud State (2/12) ... connected on season-high six 3-pointers vs. Concordia (2/11) ... led team in assists in 11 games ... ranked second on the team with 84 assists ... finished 22nd in the NSIC in scoring (13.3) ... ranked 11th in the NSIC in assists per game (3.36) ... finished seventh in the NSIC in free throw pct. (87.3) ... ranked 10th in NSIC in 3-point field goals made per game (2.05) ... ranked eighth in NSIC in assist/turnover ratio (2.1) ... ranked 17th in the country in free throw pct. (88.5).

2009-10: Started all 29 games ... only SMSU player to start every game ... averaged 26.1 minutes per game ... led the team with an SMSU freshman record 71 3-pointers ... ranked second in scoring with 11.1 points per game ... second on the team with 105 field goals .. tied an R/A Facility record with eight 3-pointers vs. Dordt (11/17) ... finished the season with 19 double-figure scoring games ... scored 20 or more points in three games ... scored season-high 26 points vs. Dordt ... had four or more 3-pointers in a game six times ... finished the NSIC ranking sixth in 3-point field goals made (2.35) ... finished ranking 77th in the country in 3-point field goals made per game (2.4) ... grabbed season-high eight rebounds in NSIC championship game vs. St. Cloud State (3/7).

2008-09: Sat out the season as a redshirt.

High School: 2008 graduate of Mitchell HS ... recorded an outstanding senior season leading the Kernels to the Class 2A state tournament championship game ... averaged 16.9 points, 5.5 rebounds and 4.0 assists per game ... named a 2008 South Dakota Mr. Basketball Finalist ... was named first team all-conference and first team all-state as a senior ... also named the Mitchell Daily Republic Player of the Year and was named to the Sioux Falls Argus Leader First Five squad ... was named most valuable player of the South Dakota Three-Class Shootout All-Star series.

Personal: Born May 15, 1989 ... son of Alan and Shelly Miller ... recreation major ... cousin Jared Miller was a guard on the SMSU menâ€™s basketball NCAA regional championship team in 2000-01 ... another cousin, Mike Miller is a currently playing in the NBA.
